name: Deimos
description: Deimos is the smaller and outer of the two moons of Mars. It is one of the smallest known moons in the Solar System and has a heavily cratered surface. Deimos orbits Mars at a greater distance compared to Phobos and takes over 30 hours to complete one orbit. It is thought to be a captured asteroid due to its irregular shape and composition.
rotation_period: Synchronous rotation; same as its orbital period (about 30.3 hours)

gallery.description: Deimos as seen by the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter
Another view of Deimos captured by the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter

interesting_facts: Deimos is the smaller and outer of the two moons of Mars.
It is one of the smallest known moons in the Solar System.
Deimos has a heavily cratered surface.
Its orbit around Mars takes over 30 hours to complete.
Deimos is thought to be a captured asteroid due to its irregular shape and composition.
It has a synchronous rotation, meaning the same side always faces Mars.
Deimos' surface temperatures range from around -4°C (25°F) to -112°C (-170°F).
